definitions.definition: the lungs of sheep or pigs used as food, especially for pets.
the natural agent that stimulates sight and makes things visible.
examples: the light of the sun

definitions.definition: a source of illumination, especially an electric lamp.
examples: a light came on in his room
synonyms: floodlight; lantern; flashlight "there was a light on in the hall"

definitions.definition: decorative illuminations.
examples: Christmas lights

definitions.definition: a traffic light.
examples: turn right at the light

definitions.definition: an expression in someone's eyes indicating a particular emotion or mood.
examples: a shrewd light entered his eyes

definitions.definition: the amount or quality of light in a place.
examples: the plant requires good light

definitions.definition: understanding of a problem or mystery; enlightenment.
examples: she saw light dawn on the woman's face
synonyms: complexion More"he saw the problem in a different light"understanding
knowledge; informallight-bulb moment "light dawned on Loretta"

definitions.definition: spiritual illumination by divine truth.
a person's opinions, standards, and abilities.
examples: leaving the police to do the job according to their lights

definitions.definition: an area of something that is brighter or paler than its surroundings.
examples: sunshine will brighten the natural lights in your hair

definitions.definition: a device that makes something start burning, as a match, lighter, or flame.
examples: he asked me for a light

definitions.definition: a window or opening in a wall to let light in.
any of the perpendicular divisions of a mullioned window.
any of the panes of glass forming the roof or side of a greenhouse or the top of a cold frame.
a person notable or eminent in a particular sphere of activity or place.
examples: such lights of liberalism as the historian Goldwin Smith

definitions.definition: provide with light or lighting; illuminate.
examples: the room was lighted by a number of small lamps
synonyms: illume "a flare lit up the night sky"

definitions.definition: switch on (an electric light).
examples: only one of the table lamps was lit

definitions.definition: become illuminated.
examples: the sign to fasten seat belts lit up

definitions.definition: make (something) start burning; ignite.
examples: Allen gathered sticks and lit a fire

definitions.definition: begin to burn; be ignited.
examples: the gas wouldn't light properly

definitions.definition: ignite a cigarette, cigar, or pipe and begin to smoke it.
examples: she lit up a cigarette and puffed on it serenely

definitions.definition: come upon or discover by chance.
examples: he lit on a possible solution
synonyms: come up with "we'd almost given up when we lit upon this article about Mathew's murder trial"

definitions.definition: descend.
examples: from the horse he lit down

definitions.definition: fall and settle or land on (a surface).
examples: a feather just lighted on the ground
